item.title: Clashes Erupt in Beirut Over Deadly Explosion
item.description: Tens of thousands of protesters converged, some clashing with security forces and taking over government buildings, as they demanded justice for a deadly explosion in the capital they blame on their leaders.

item.title: Brazil Faces Somber Covid-19 Milestone at 100,000 Deaths
item.description: The new coronavirus has spread beyond Brazil’s megacities, tearing through smaller towns and rural areas as the country’s president says stricter public-health rules would do too much economic harm.

item.title: Air India Express Jet Overshoots Runway, Killing 18
item.description: An Air India Express flight carrying 190 people overshot the runway amid heavy rain in southern India, according to the country’s civil-aviation agency.

item.title: New Chapter in U.S.-China Ties Marked by Confrontation
item.description: The Trump administration’s cascade of actions taken against Beijing represent a new chapter in U.S.-China relations, one marked by increasing confrontation and few efforts to de-escalate the tensions.

item.title: Canada Ramps Up Retaliation Against U.S. Over Aluminum Tariff
item.description: Canada plans to slap its own tariffs on a range of U.S. products that contain aluminum in retaliation to President Trump’s latest move to aggravate one of the world’s largest trading relationships.

item.title: Pro-China Populists Consolidate Power in Sri Lanka
item.description: The Rajapaksa family cemented its grip on Sri Lanka in parliamentary elections, according to results released Friday, gaining enough seats to push through constitutional changes increasing executive power.
